items.title: Greens deal in play as Coalition backs away from Labor's hate and gun reforms
items.description: Liberals are backing away from a push to tackle antisemitism with stronger racial hatred laws, with some senior figures in the party also voicing freedom of speech concerns.

items.title: Firefighters gain ground across Victoria as damage toll rises
items.description: More than 228 homes have been confirmed destroyed by bushfires across Victoria, with authorities warning the total is likely to rise.

items.title: It is now very likely Trump will order his military option of choice on Iran
items.description: The Iranian regime has done exactly what Donald Trump warned against. Despite the information blackout, it is clear hundreds, if not thousands, of protesters have died and the US president is now likely to order a response, writes John Lyons.

items.title: Iran warns of retaliation as US withdraws troops from Middle East bases
items.description: It comes as Iran's judiciary defied US warnings and said those detained over anti-regime protests could face execution.

items.title: FBI raids home and seizes devices of Washington Post journalist
items.description: The reporter had previously reported on the Trump administration's efforts to fire hundreds of thousands of federal workers.

items.title: Hot tubs, ice and penguins: Life working in Antarctica
items.description: From 6,000 applications each year, only about 300 make the cut to travel down to Antarctica and experience a workplace like no other.

items.title: X to change AI chatbot after outrage over sexual deepfake images
items.description: New laws in the UK that would outlaw the generation of sexual deepfakes are set to come into force this week.

items.title: At least 32 killed after crane falls on Thai passenger train
items.description: A crane used to construct an elevated high-speed railway has fallen onto a moving train travelling from Bangkok to Ubon Ratchathani province, officials say.

items.title: Ukraine's former PM Yulia Tymoshenko facing allegations of bribery
items.description: Anti-corruption watchdogs in Ukraine have searched the offices of the country's former prime minister Yulia Tymoshenko amid allegations of a major bribery scheme.

items.title: Festival director warned board about Writers' Week fallout
items.description: As the Adelaide Festival director reveals he had urged the festival's board not to cancel Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, a former board member opens up about his very different concerns about the Adelaide Writers' Week program.

items.title: What life was like in 2025 across the planet in a changing climate
items.description: Extreme heat, droughts, storms and deadly floods challenged resilience not only in Australia, but across the globe.

items.title: 'No joke, London Bridge has fallen down': The moment two tourists were trapped by nature
items.description: Kelli Bryers wasn't sure if anyone had seen the London Bridge collapse just seconds after she and her cousin, David Darrington, had crossed it.

items.title: Captured tobacco kingpin thought 'he was out of reach', says Burke
items.description: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke says he believes tobacco kingpin Kaz Hamad thought he was "out of reach" of authorities before his arrest in Iraq.

items.title: Hackers access student emails, passwords in major school data breach
items.description: Hackers have accessed the emails, passwords and names of past and present students from all Victorian government schools in a major data breach.

items.title: More than 220 homes now confirmed lost in Victorian bushfires
items.description: Victoria's bushfires have now burnt across 404,000 hectares, or a total area more than five times the size of Singapore.

items.title: 'Can't speak': Tennis battler beats the pros to take home $1 million jackpot
items.description: Sydneysider Jordan Smith has beaten grand slam champion Jannik Sinner and dual grand slam finalist Amanda Anasimova to take home the prize in the novelty format.

items.title: Cow survives 80km swim in floodwater before washing ashore on beach
items.description: Amid the damage from flooding in Central Queensland, tales of livestock surviving are emerging, including one cow's incredible waterlogged journey.

items.title: Trump says US needs Greenland for purpose of national security
items.description: Greenlandic and Danish foreign ministers will meet US Vice-President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Washington after the US renews threats to take control of the Arctic island.

items.title: Search underway for missing diver in Antarctica
items.description: Australian authorities say they are "investigating all the options available" to assist a search operation for a diver missing in Antarctica.

items.title: Op shops are calling for people to think before they donate
items.description: Op shops ask people to be mindful of what they donate following an influx of donations over the new year.

items.title: Shops pull Craig Silvey's books off shelves in response to charges
items.description: The fallout of the high-profile child exploitation material allegations against Craig Silvey starts to ripple through the literary community, as the renowned author faces charges of possessing and distributing illicit material.

items.title: 'Unacceptable': Juveniles charged, e-rideables crushed in police crackdown
items.description: Police charge 25 youths and seize and destroy dozens of electric scooters and off-road bikes in a targeted crackdown on e-rideables in Perth's northern suburbs.

items.title: 'She watches a lot more cricket than I do': Healy taken aback by commentary praise
items.description: After calling time on her decorated 15-year career, a spell in media commentary looks inevitable for Australian cricket star Alyssa Healy.

items.title: Cultural claim over key Brisbane Olympic site knocked back
items.description: Federal Environment Minister Murray Watt has rejected a cultural heritage claim on the site of Brisbane's Olympic stadium, and has appointed an independent facilitator to mediate between interested parties.

items.title: Air-drying laundry, wooden chopping boards: Reducing exposure to microplastics at home
items.description: Researchers say there are some simple ways to help minimise our exposure to the microplastics and nanoplastics in our homes.
